sections.title: READING
sections.passage: Podcasting has exploded in popularity over the last decade, transforming from a niche hobby into a mainstream medium. A podcast is essentially a digital audio file, usually episodic, that users can download to a personal device for easy listening. The format's appeal lies in its accessibility and versatility. Listeners can tune in during commutes, while exercising, or during household chores, making it a perfect medium for multitasking. The range of content is vast, covering everything from investigative journalism and in-depth interviews to comedy and fictional storytelling. This diversity means there's a podcast for almost every interest imaginable. For creators, the relatively low barrier to entry—often just a microphone and basic editing software—has empowered countless individuals and organizations to share their voices and stories with a global audience. However, the sheer volume of content has created a new challenge: discoverability. With millions of podcasts available, standing out and finding an audience can be difficult for new creators. Despite this, the medium continues to grow, influencing everything from marketing strategies to how we consume news and entertainment.

parts.text: The four-day work week is a concept that has been gaining (6) ______ in recent years. Proponents argue that it can lead to increased productivity, improved employee well-being, and lower operational costs for companies. Several trials have shown positive results, with employees reporting a better work-life balance (7) ______ feeling less burned out. However, there are concerns about whether this model can be applied universally across all industries. Some sectors may find it challenging to maintain service levels with reduced hours. (8) ______ the potential difficulties, the idea is compelling enough that more companies are deciding to experiment (9) ______ it. The success of these trials will largely depend on careful planning and a willingness to adapt (10) ______ traditional ways of working.

questions.question: 6. A ground B space C speed D traction
7. A while B despite C because D unless
8. A Despite B Although C However D Moreover
9. A on B with C for D about
10. A from B to C away D on

parts.text: Personal finance management is an essential life skill. Developing good habits early on can prevent future (16) ........................ difficulties. It is important to create a realistic budget to track your income and expenses. This provides (17) ........................ on where your money is going. Making (18) ........................ decisions about spending is key to achieving long-term financial goals. While saving money requires (19) ........................, the sense of security it brings is invaluable. Ultimately, financial (20) ........................ allows you to have more control over your life.

questions.question: (17) ........................ on where your money is going (CLEAR)
(18) ........................ decisions about spending (SENSE)
(20) ........................ allows you to have more control (DEPEND)
